metadata.title: IR Assistant | Your companion in fighting insulin resistance
metadata.description: Free app helping people with insulin resistance make better food choices. Scan products, analyze menus, learn about IR. No ads, no data collection.

hero.heading: Scan. Understand. Decide.
hero.subheading: Free assistant for people with insulin resistance. Scan products, analyze restaurant menus, learn about IR. No ads, no data collection.

scanning.title: Product Scanning
scanning.description: Scan barcodes and product labels. Get instant assessment of impact on blood sugar levels.
scanning.bullet1_desc: Integration with Open Food Facts - a global food products database.
scanning.bullet2_desc: Label recognition works without internet thanks to on-device AI.
scanning.bullet3_desc: Clear scoring considering IR - you immediately know if the product is right for you.

analysis.title: Dish & Menu Analysis
analysis.description: Take a photo of a dish or restaurant menu. AI will analyze the composition and provide a ranking of the best choices.
analysis.bullet1_desc: Take a photo of your plate - AI will recognize ingredients and assess glycemic impact.
analysis.bullet2_desc: Take a photo of the menu card - get a ranking from best to dishes to avoid.
analysis.bullet3_desc: Each analysis includes explanation of the score and practical tips.

learning.title: Learning About IR
learning.description: Quiz with 420+ questions, daily tips and activity streaks. Learn by doing, not by rules.
learning.bullet1_desc: Over 420 questions in 5 categories. Test your knowledge and learn new things.
learning.bullet2_desc: A new practical tip about living with insulin resistance every day.
learning.bullet3_desc: Build a habit of using the app daily and track your progress.

privacy.title: Privacy in DNA
privacy.description: We don't collect user data. No accounts, no registration, no ads. Your health, your privacy.
privacy.bullet1_desc: No registration or login required. Install and use.
privacy.bullet2_desc: Zero ads, zero trackers, zero behavioral profiling.
privacy.bullet3_desc: Photos are processed locally and immediately deleted. Nothing leaves your device.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.subtitle: We believe everyone deserves access to tools supporting their health. Regardless of financial situation.

proBono.title: Pro Bono
proBono.description: The app was created out of a need to help. The creator himself struggles with insulin resistance and knows how hard it is to find reliable information.

community.title: Community
community.description: We're building a community of people with IR. Together it's easier - we share knowledge, experiences and support each other.

privacyValue.title: Privacy
privacyValue.description: We don't collect data. We don't profile. We don't sell. Your health is your business - we just help.

free.title: Always Free
free.description: Basic app features will always be free. No ads, no hidden costs, no time limits.

mission.quote: Insulin resistance affects millions of people. We want everyone to have access to a tool that helps make informed food choices. You don't have to be an expert - just scan the product.
mission.author: Wojciech Wlodek, Creator of IR Assistant

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: Yes! The app is completely free and will remain so. Basic features (product scanning, label OCR, scan history, knowledge quiz) will always be available for free. No ads or hidden fees.
faq.q2: Do I need to create an account?
faq.a2: No! IR Assistant doesn't require registration or login. Just download the app and start using it. All data is stored locally on your device.
faq.a3: Partially yes. Barcode scanning requires internet connection (to fetch product data), but label OCR works completely offline thanks to on-device AI. Scan history is always available offline.
faq.a4: Practically none. We don't collect personal data, don't identify users, don't track location. Photos are processed locally and immediately deleted. The only collected data is anonymous, aggregated usage statistics (optional).
faq.a5: The algorithm considers sugar content, net carbs, fiber, protein and detected high-GI ingredients (syrups, maltodextrin). Score 80-100 is OK (green), 40-79 is Limit (yellow), below 40 is Risk (red). Details in the app.
faq.q6: On which devices does the app work?
faq.a6: Currently IR Assistant is available on Android (Google Play). iOS version is in preparation. The app requires Android 6.0 or higher.
